title: Should I get Hulu or Roku and why? - Quora

response.answer_text: Roku is a line of digital media players manufactured by American company Roku, Inc. The devices offer access to streaming media content from various online services. The line was introduced in May 2008 with its first model, developed in collaboration with Netflix. Hulu is an American subscription video on demand service fully controlled and majority-owned by Walt Disney Direct-to-Consumer & International, a business segment of The Walt Disney Company, with NBCUniversal, owned by Comcast, as an equity stakeholder. It’s two different things, so you can’t compare it. I recommend you to get XOOMTV if you want to stream all your favorite shows from different streaming providers in HD.

Just to help clarify…these are not mutually exclusive. Roku is a platform or a device, like a computer. Hulu is a service that will run on MANY different devices. Thus, you could get a Roku device and use it to watch Hulu. Similarly, you could watch Hulu on an Xbox, an Apple TV, an Amazon Fire Stick, your smartphone, a tablet, your computer…you get the idea. Hope that helps!
